Bindings with a coat of arms, or any part of a coat of arms, e.g., a crest.
Use for bindings produced during the 1920s and 1930s, in Art Deco style, often characterized by sleek, geometric, or stylized forms.

CONCEPT.SN: For any kind of errors in binding, except folding errors.

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Binding labels" may have been indexed as "Labels."
Scope note added 6/2007; disambiguated from "panel-stamped bindings" based on literary warrant.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for cloth or leather bindings, originally appearing in the 1820s, with blind, gilt, or color designs made from the impression of relief blocks.
Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.SN: Use only with subdivisions, to identify noteworthy binding types, styles, and techniques which cannot be otherwise classified using terms on this list.

CONCEPT.SN: Use for box structures that include two three-sided trays (one made to fit inside the other when closed) attached to a case.
CONCEPT.BT: Protective housing (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Cloth binding labels" may have been indexed as "Cloth labels."

CONCEPT.SN: Not for publishers’ cloth; primarily for 16th-17th century bindings covered in cloth.
CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Approved 6/2008
CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings in which the curved prongs of a strip of metal, plastic, etc., pass through a series of holes in a margin of the text block.

CONCEPT.BT: Categories of bindings/Occasions for binding (Gathering term;do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Rem added 7/00.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings made of corrugated board.
Robert Southey’s cloth book covers.

CONCEPT.CM: "Cuir-ciselé or cut leather is a self-explanatory decorative technique: the leather is given patterns inscribed by a knife or other sharp tool."--Needham

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Decorated paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Decorated papers."
CONCEPT.SN: Use for the occurrence of such papers as any part of bindings, cases, endpapers, or doublures.
CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 2/97.

CONCEPT.BT: Types of binding structure (Gathering term; do not assign)
Ancillary structures (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: A detachable flexible cover (usually paper) for a book. Cf. Wrappers.
CONCEPT.BT: Protective housing (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: The identification of the author, title, etc. of a book written on the edge of its block.
Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.
Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Embossed paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Embossed papers."

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Engraved paper binding labels" may have been indexed as "Engraved paper labels."

CONCEPT.SN: Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

An English binding style used from the 1770s through the first few decades of the nineteenth century. Characterized by an outer border of palmettes created by acid staining, and a central panel which is usually tree calf.

CONCEPT.DESCRIPTOR: Fastenings, Attachments, or Titling (Gathering term; do not assign)
CONCEPT.SN: Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.
Decorative work using fine wires, usually gold or silver. Use for filigree occurring anywhere on bindings or casings.
CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings which include or employ flaps.
CONCEPT.BT: Types of binding structure (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Flock paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Flocked papers."

CONCEPT.SN: For errors in folding one or more sheets of text.

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Metal attachments to one or both covers. Their function is to protect the binding.
CONCEPT.BT: Fastenings, Attachments, or Titling (Gathering term; do not assign)
Types of binding structure (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Bindings with a design impressed by a block through gold.

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.CM: "Gold tooling--the bonding of gold leaf to leather by means of heated stamps."--Needham

"Points of this fashion include the use of wooden boards, with grooved edges; smooth backs, with no bands showing through; raised headcaps at top and bottom of the back, containing a double row of sewn headbands; edges of the leaves cut flush with the boards; clasps made of braided leather, catching on pins protruding from the edge of the boards of the upper covers."--Needham.

CONCEPT.SN: 16th century; decorated with grotesque figures, usually classical.

CONCEPT.BT: Types of binding structure (Gathering term; do not assign)
Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)
Ancillary structures (Gathering term; do not assign)
Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Use for books bound with blank leaves systematically inserted between the original leaves, whether by the publisher or owner, to facilitate user-added content.
CONCEPT.BT: Text block (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 2/97.

CONCEPT.SN: Bindings dyed by means of Kermes (a red dyestuff obtained from a Mediterranean scale insect). Kermes was largely supplanted by cochineal as a dyestuff after the latter's introduction into Europe in the 16th and 17th centuries.
CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Bindings with scenes on their covers which are first painted and then covered with lacquer. Primarily 16th century; the painted scenes can be on leather or pasteboard.
CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)
Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Use for any kind of limp binding.
CONCEPT.BT: Types of binding structure (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Approved 6/2005.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for headbands woven by machine on cloth or other type of support, often in imitation of worked headbands.

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Marbled paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Marbled papers."
Proposed by Rose-Ann Movsovic; term approved 1/2006
CONCEPT.SN: Use for sheepsking bindings whose surface has been treated with acid to produce a marbled effect.

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Bindings decorated with Masonic motifs; primarily late 18th and early 19th centuries.

CONCEPT.DESCRIPTOR: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)
CONCEPT.SN: Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.HN: Submitted by: Jennie Clements, UNC Chapel Hill, 9/9/11; added 6/26/2012.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for novelty bindings decorated using a technique that originated in the 1830s in the Scottish town of Mauchline, in which wooden boards are decorated with stenciling, transfer prints, photographs, etc., then heavily varnished.

CONCEPT.HN: Approved 6/2008.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings in which a device of metal, plastic, etc., holds single leaves together in a non-exchangeable manner.
CONCEPT.BT: Types of binding structure (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Found on books and manuscripts bound for Sir Thomas Phillipps' library at Middle Hill. The usual style is a drab colored paper over millboard, without pastedowns or other endpapers. The text block is sewn on two cords, which are laced through the boards. Phillipps' shelf-mark is usually present in the form: [Roman numeral].[lowercase letter].[Arabic numeral].

CONCEPT.CM: A Spanish binding style, used in the 13th-15th centuries, "with Islamic decorative schemes: elaborate geometric interlace bands against a background entirely filled with hundreds of repetitions of small knotwork or cablework tools." -- Needham.

CONCEPT.BT: Types of binding structure (Gathering term; do not assign)
Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: For examples of original covers as issued by the bookseller, publisher, etc.
CONCEPT.BT: Categories of bindings/Occasions for binding (Gathering term;do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 2/97.

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Painted paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Painted papers."
Approved 6/2007. Disambiguated from "blocked bindings" based on literary warant.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for leather bindings with designs in relief from the impression of intaglio dies, produced predominantly in the 15th and 16th centuries.

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Paper binding labels" may have been indexed as "Paper labels."

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Approved 6/2008.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for decorative pieces of paper adhered to the cover material of a binding, frequently color-printed and employed in the decoration of publishers' cloth bindings

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Paste paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Paste papers."

CONCEPT.CM: "A number of later sixteenth-century Parisian 'penitential' bindings are tooled in silver on dark brown morocco to create a somber appearance." -- Needham

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 01/01.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for cloth bindings produced ca. 1835-1846, characterized by a central ornament in which the cloth was ornamented before the case was made, as described by Krupp & Rosner, "Pre-Ornamented Bookcloth on Nineteenth-Century Cloth Bindings," PBSA 94:2.

CONCEPT.BT: Categories of bindings/Occasions for binding (Gathering term;do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Printed paper binding labels" may have been indexed as "Printed paper labels."
Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Printed paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Printed papers."

CONCEPT.SN: Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.BT: Categories of bindings/Occasions for binding (Gathering term;do not assign)

CONCEPT.CM: "A type of decoration of Islamic origin in which small punched depressions in the leather are filled with a kind of colored gesso." -- Needham

CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 01/01.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings of deeply embossed leather executed in Leake's patent relievo process (1846-1850s).
A conscious imitation of an earlier style.

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 7/00.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for cloth bindings embossed by machines used to emboss ribbons, thereby giving the bindings a raised, often floral pattern.
Use for ribbons attached at the head of the spine to be used as a place marker in the book. For unattached devices intended to be inserted between leaves in a book as a place marker, use Bookmarks.
CONCEPT.BT: Fastenings, Attachments, or Titling (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.SN: Manuscript ruling in red ink in order to set off the text.

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 6/02.

CONCEPT.SN: Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.HN: Term added 6/06. Proposed by Nina Schneider.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for protective containers open along one edge.
CONCEPT.BT: Protective housing (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.CM: "'Somber' bindings of silver-tooled black morocco were common in Restoration England." -- Needham.

CONCEPT.SN: Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.HN: Approved 6/2008.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings in which a coil of metal, plastic, etc., passes through a series of holes in a margin of the text block.

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Sprinkled paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Sprinkled papers."

CONCEPT.SN: Use for leather stained in ways other than by marbling, mottling, or sprinkling. This includes staining by means of blocking, stencilling, or free-hand design.

Use for vellum bindings that have been colored by the application of a dilute colored liquid, a process that results in a transparent color that penetrates the material, allowing the underlying texture of the skin to be visible.
Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.HN: Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Stamped paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Stamped papers."
Changed 6/2016. Formerly, "Stencilled paper bindings" may have been indexed as "Stencilled papers."

CONCEPT.SN: Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.
Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.
Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.

CONCEPT.HN: Approved 6/2005
CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings in which the case is attached to the text block by means tackets, such as strips of parchment or leather thongs.

CONCEPT.SN: Use for cut-outs on the fore-edge of a book intended for locating sections within the volume, especially common on dictionaries and Bibles.
Gathering term; do not use; index under a narrower term.
CONCEPT.BT: Fastenings, Attachments, or Titling (Gathering term; do not assign)
Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.CM: "Cutout leatherwork, or tracery, was never a common technique in European bookbinding, but examples are known from the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries ... Several of the earliest European gold-tooled bookbindings, from both Venice and Naples, have leather tracery decoration, which was brought out, as in the Islamic archetypes, by being laid over a bright azure ground." -- Needham.
CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.CM: "Covered with gold and silver, ivories, enamelwork, and gems." -- Needham.
CONCEPT.BT: Materials and treatment (Gathering term; do not assign)

CONCEPT.CM: In case of doubt use Tree calf bindings.

CONCEPT.HN: Approved 6/2005.
CONCEPT.SN: Use for bindings with no title or author’s name on the spine or cover.

CONCEPT.SN: Books in which the folded edges of the sections have not been trimmed away or opened by a utensil such as a knife.

CONCEPT.CM: Originally proposed to include bindings whose elements have become visible through wear; BSC edited scope to reflect only bindings whose elements were designed to be visible.

CONCEPT.SN: A physically attached flexible cover for a book. Cf. Dust jacket.
